greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) gives the number of set partitions of {1,...,n} with maximum block length k.
comment: Row sums are A000110 (Bell numbers). Second column is A001189 (Degree n permutations of order exactly 2).
Partition product of prod_{j=0..n-1}((k + 1)*j - 1) and n! at k = -1,
summed over parts with equal biggest part (see the Luschny link).
Same partition product with length statistic is A008277.
Construct an array in which n-th row is the partition function G(n,k), where G(n,1),...G(n,6) = A000012, A000085, A001680, A001681, A110038, A148092, with the first few rows
Rows tend to A000110, the Bell numbers. Taking finite differences from the top, then reorienting, we obtain triangle A080510.
The n-th row of the array is the eigensequence of an infinite lower triangular matrix with n diagonals of Pascal's triangle starting from the right and the rest zeros. (End)
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..141, flattened
J. Riordan, Letter, 11/23/1970. See second page of letter.
formula: E.g.f. for k-th column: exp(exp(x)*GAMMA(k, x)/(k-1)!-1)*(exp(x^k/k!)-1). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Feb 04 2005
T(n,0) = [n = 0] (Iverson notation) and for n > 0 and 1 <= m <= n
T(n,m) = Sum_{a} M(a)|f^a| where a = a_1,..,a_n such that
example: T(4,3) = 4 since there are 4 set partitions with longest block of length 3 : {{1},{2,3,4}}, {{1,3,4},{2}}, {{1,2,3},{4}} and {{1,2,4},{3}}.
maple: seq(seq(T(n, k), k=1..n), n=1..12);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 20 2012
mathematica: b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = If[n == 0, 1, If[i<1, 0, Sum[b[n-i*j, i-1]*n!/i!^j/(n-i*j)!/j!, {j, 0, n/i}]]]; T[n_, k_] := b[n, k]-b[n, k-1]; Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 1, n}], {n, 1, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 25 2014, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Take differences along rows of A229223. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 10 2018
results.author: _Wouter Meeussen_, Mar 22 2003
